{"numberOfPeople":"2","name":"bingliang chen","phoneNumber":"0860107230","email":"bingliangchan@gmail.com","tour":{"name":"Aran Islands (Inisheer) and Cliffs of Moher","price":40,"countryId":1,"ratingNumber":4,"tagCat":1,"content":"
  • 1 Day
  • Lunch not included
  • Cliffs Of Moher
  • No age restriction

Booking Now

Description

This unique tour gives you a minimum 5 hour stop at the Cliffs of Moher (entry fee included).

If you’re into walking, photography, exploring or quite simply wish to take your time and enjoy a day at the world famous Cliffs of Moher, this is the tour for you.

Departing from the Kinlay Hostel on Merchants Road, Galway at 09:00 daily, your fully trained, local driver / guide will take you on a scenic journey along the Wild Atlantic Way, through the lunar-like landscape of the Burren and on to the Cliffs of Moher.

Heading towards the Cliffs of Moher, you will pass through the picturesque villages of Clarenbridge (home to the Clarenbridge International Oyster Festival every September), Kilcolgan, Ballindereen, Kinvara, Ballyvaughan and Doolin.

Along the way you will see Medieval ruins, 16th century tower house castles, churches and graveyards, dry stone walls, quays and harbours, ponies and horses, calves and cows, lambs and sheep and maybe even a leprechaun or two.

Turning right in Ballyvaughan, your local driver / guide will take you south following the Wild Atlantic Way along the coast of Co. Clare, via Blackhead (Wild Atlantic Way – Discovery Point), Fanore Strand (Wild Atlantic Way – Discovery Point) and the fishing village of Doolin.

From here you can witness the power of the Atlantic Ocean as it battles the coastline of Ireland, this is the Wild Atlantic Way.

Once at the Cliffs of Moher (Wild Atlantic Way – Signature Point) your local driver / guide will present you with your complmentary ticket to the Cliffs of Moher visitor centre, the Atlantic Edge. Now you’ll have a minimum 5 hours to spend as you wish at the Cliffs of Moher.

At the end of your Cliffs of Moher stop, you will return to Galway via Lisdoonvarna (home to the world famous match-making festival every September) and once agin through the limestone, glacio-karst landscape that makes up the Burren.

Summary
Depart/Return Location Galway
Depart Time 9:00AM (Arrive 10 mins before)
Return Time Approximately 19:30pm .
We recommend you clothing T-shirt， sport shoes
Tour included
  • Tour guide
  • One hour free
  • Coach
NOT INCLUDED
  • Shopping
  • Lunch
  • Accommodation
